source.value: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 81

dr.exceptions: force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical
dr.label: All

description.value:
The target is overtaken with uncontrollable laughter. It must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is plagued with uncontrollable laugher. It can't use reactions.

Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed} 1 and can't use reactions.

Critical Failure The target falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Prone]{Prone} and can't use actions or reactions for 1 round. It then suffers the failure effects.

Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}. This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Hidden]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.

Success The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell.

Failure The target's attitude becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Friendly]{Friendly} toward you. If it was @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Friendly]{Friendly}, it becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Helpful]{Helpful}. It can't use hostile actions against you.

Critical Failure The target's attitude becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Helpful]{Helpful} toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you.

Heightened The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations.

Heightened The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 1.

Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 2.

Critical Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 3 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fleeing]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened You can target up to five creatures.
You link your mind to the target's mind and mentally impart to that target an amount of information in an instant that could otherwise be communicated in 10 minutes.

You create an auditory illusion of simple sounds that has a maximum volume equal to four normal humans shouting. The sounds emanate from a square you designate within range. You can't create intelligible words or other intricate sounds (such as music).

Heightened The range increases to 60 feet.

Heightened The range increases to 120 feet.

You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a spell attack attack against the target. If you hit, you deal bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage-as appropriate for the object you hurled-equal to 1d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier. No specific traits or magic properties of the hurled item affect the attack or the damage.

Critical Success You deal double damage.

Success You deal full damage.

Heightened The damage increases by 1d6.

30 feet. The muse phantom inspires a supernatural emotional response-either comedy or drama. Each creature that begins its turn in the aura must attempt a Will save; on a failure, the creature is affected as long as it remains within the aura. If the muse phantom is emitting a comedic aura, affected creatures become clumsy 1; if it is emitting a dramatic aura, affected creatures instead become stupefied 1.
The muse phantom can change its aura from comedic to dramatic or vice-versa, or cease or activate this aura, by spending a single action, which has the concentrate trait. A creature possessed by a muse phantom is immune to this aura.

Requirements The muse phantom's thespian aura is active;
Effect The muse ceases its thespian aura and deals [[/r 4d8 # mental damage]] mental damage to creatures in a 30-foot burst, including the creature it is possessing, if any (basic Will save). Creatures that fail their Will saves are fascinated by the muse phantom for 1 minute. The muse phantom can't use Grand Finale again for 1d4 rounds.

The phantom muse attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature. This has the same effect as the possession spell (DC 20), except the duration is 1d4 hours, and since the phantom muse doesn't have a physical body, it is unaffected by that restriction of the spell. If the target is at least trained in Performance, the DC of this ability is 24.
